conclusion: Analyze the flow paths from points A, B, and C to determine which container the liquid will flow into.
Liquid from point A flows downwards and to the right.
Liquid from point A encounters a baffle that directs it to the left.
Liquid continues to flow leftward and downwards, passing through another baffle that directs it to the right.
Liquid flows rightward and downwards, passing through a third baffle that directs it to the left.
Liquid flows leftward and downwards, entering container D.
Liquid from point B flows downwards and to the right.
Liquid from point B encounters a baffle that directs it to the left.
Liquid continues to flow leftward and downwards, passing through another baffle that directs it to the right.
Liquid flows rightward and downwards, passing through a third baffle that directs it to the left.
Liquid flows leftward and downwards, entering container D.
Liquid from point C flows downwards and to the right.
Liquid from point C encounters a baffle that directs it to the left.
Liquid continues to flow leftward and downwards, passing through another baffle that directs it to the right.
Liquid flows rightward and downwards, passing through a third baffle that directs it to the left.
Liquid flows leftward and downwards, entering container D.
The liquid from points A, B, and C will flow into container D after passing through the baffles.
